comments.body: I think that if the skulk sensor was behind the piston, it should still be able to hear the sound, since there's no wool there, but if it's in front of the piston, it shouldn't hear a sound because of the wool.
At the very least, they could drop feather particles, especially when hit
Muddy Pigs could drop mud particles

I think we should be able to shear chickens because I want to get the feathers for arrows but I don't want to hurt the little guys! It makes me so sad to have to kill my chickens! :( I think dropping off feathers randomly might make too many entities in a world, after all, the chickens only lay one egg each day, and I have no idea how many feathers they would drop. But at least shearing the feathers off to pluck them would be so great! And if you have to feed them seeds to get the feathers back, that would make it so you don't get too many. It's easy to get tons of seeds after all.

I have chickens in real life, they rarely shed feathers (if they even do at all) and shearing them would put them through tremendous pain. You're just gonna have to settle with killing the little guys :(
I forgot to say, chickens can take 3 - 12 months for their feathers to grow back.
This should also happen with parrots.

Oh gosh yes. 
Or just ANY other use for spider eyes. Trading with Clerics for example.

If you have a spider spawner you collect chests full of the things and the only use for them is fermented spider eyes for potions, which you hardly need any for.
They're actually only gonna spawn in the Lush Caves.
I agree
Yes they should be placed denser around the trunk then get less and less as distance increases
This was already suggested here

i second this, but if they don't want to put it on isolated islands, i wouldn't mind having it fully encircled by dark forests either, since their tree designs are so similar that the transition won't be as sharp

In that case, why would you need to go to the island, without a unique item or char or something else from would make sense. The forest in the normal world will be difficult to bypass and will have to pass through it because of which you can meet a mob.
I think this is a great idea! But maybe maple syrup in a bottle instead of a bucket.
Agreed @permalink also maybe a new wood/log type also a new leaf type. Like honey blocks maybe make a maple block sticky on the side and can't jump
maybe you could put bread and a bucket of syrup in the crafting table and make pancakes :3
Yes, please! It's goofy and illogical with parts sticking out. It'd work better as just a shell-textured block. Not like it won't be unrecognisable.
Yes, please! Just limit the Mending book (which we all use these villagers for tbh honest) to master level and not villager biome types...

The enderman light level change returns casual players to the experience from the beginning of 1.18 where endermen were nearly impossible to find in warped forests and the late game was much harder to access as a result. It also doesn't fix the portal problem, because technical players skip right to building enderman farms in the end. If you want to nerf portal farms, change the light levels for ghasts and zombified piglins, not endermen.
It would be nice if the /fillbiome command had a tweak with and without the layering of biomes. Like "/fillbiome [2dbiome/3dbiome]"
Hi, I think when a player pick the dragon head, it can move like with redstone. No?
I think the Piglin heads should be able to be used like golden armor. When wearing the head, it should make Piglins passive, as they are tricked into thinking that you're one of them.
Will they add more heads from other mobs to the game? the most mythical ones as for example the enderman, blaze, wither boss, spider, villager, pillager, cow or pig
I love the changes to chiseled bookshelves but I think if each book slot could be dyed and glow dyed that would add so much storytelling and decoration to the chiseled bookshelf.
add a way to add custom blocks via json since datapacks that uses mods can not report bugs

add a complaints system for the bug tracker

had bad mods make them invaild with out even telling me why forced me to cheat the system just to get read if i wanted it to take less then a year i got banned for that

It would be great if bookshelves were lockable like chests and other containers

It is possible to place locked containers with this command:

/setblock ~ ~ ~ container{Lock:"Key"}
It would be an excellent feature for adventure maps because it would allow creators to make some bookshelves accessible and others inaccessible.

I've found that although it's great that the vex has the old hitbox, it's not centered the best. While the bottom lines up with the allay's hitbox, the actual texture/model drops below the hitbox, while still leaving a large gap above. This could be evened out to make the vex visually take up more of the hitbox without reducing the hitbox size, and also center it more so that misses aren't only rewarded from above. =]

New texture is a great adaptation to the size that it is. ^-^

Hi Mojang,

Could you please add back in the original inventory setting? The new placement is kind of confusing.
How would that even work iwould do random dimensions again plus something like random blocks are added
Should be renamed the 1984 update.

Let's get the bad stuff out first:
-fireflies should be a decorative mob  like fish that you can put in bottles
-birch forests don't necessarly need much of an update,just making the trees bigger would do wonders (could be great for all forests actually)
Ok now for the good stuff:
-frogs are very derpy and cute :D
-the mangrove swamp is one of the best looking biomes in the game and I hope that all of the biomes will have this unique feel to them
-chest boats are great for early transportation
-the deep dark is a very cool biome,but it would benefit from a reason to explore them other than the ancient cities (I really liked the idea of fossils,maybe higher chance for the diamond variant?)
-the ancient city loot is almost perfect,I think it should be able to contain all types or armor and not just leggings 

-one more change to the warden that I think would be great is that the protection enchantment shouldn't effect the damage the ranged attack does

-the allays are great,but still need a few tweaks with the pathfinding (maybe make them locate the player faster)

-I think a lot of parity features could really improve the game and make it more "wild" (fallen logs,snowy leaves etc.)
-the big portal in the ancient cities should do something

I've been testing the changes to iron golems and despite it does not affect the amount of iron you can get in an iron farm, it cause that iron golems can spawn in blocks like glass and string even if they didnt can in 1.18.2. This may result in problems designing and decorating iron farms in 1.19. 

Everything else in the snapshot is great
Can you sort out caves like this datapack does better cave gen that adds new cave biome kinda bland
u should add the fireflies, even if it is just a decorative mob, like bats or polarbears

I’d simply recommend a rename of the update, or a clarification that this is less of a particularly nature based update in terms of the biomes, and more of an update adding darkness and murky styled things to the game for diversity. I’m beyond sure you’ve seen one million firefly comments, but in truth it’s more symbolic of a general consensus on how this update wasn't about the nature and biomes, and is actually focused on the deep dark, with a couple touches from a new tree & frogs.

The chat preview is a great idea!

If chat messages are being sent to the server as they are typed, like commands, could the server send back tab complete lists as well?

For example, a server owner could set up a list of emojis as text, so a player can start typing the name of the emoji, and then select the correct one with the arrow keys, and press tab to complete typing.

That millions of firefly comments is people actually wanting the firefly. Something simple like firefly particle effects on swamps and mangroves add SO MUCH to the game, ambience is something that this game really needs.

It's very strange that Mojang is so fixated on fireflies needing to have a use (fireflies in bottles can provide that). But when Mojang tries to give something a use, like echo shards and goat horns, it usually ends up as useless collectibles.

Please stop being so scared of fireflies being poisonous to frogs, just prevent frogs from eating them. Please stop trying to teach kids, this isn't minecraft education edition. These beliefs are really suffocating minecraft's potential. I play bedrock edition so I don't have access to mods...

While I'm against toxic people complaining about the update, I'm also against the idea of grouping all criticism into "haters". There's a lot of people who are passionate about Minecraft & cares about its growth.

Bug fixes are important & it's an understandable reason why updates are slow. But I feel like there's a Minecraft vanilla formula that's hindering the game's growth too much. Everything needs to fit perfectly into the game, graphics need to be iconic, there's a lot of back-and-forth before ideas are made, and somehow it needs to be kid-friendly, teaching kids that fireflies are bad to frogs, etc.

I feel like Mojang is too afraid of making big changes, afraid of "copying from modders". We can't have epic legendary gear from ancient cities, as music discs are a "smaller and more vanilla friendly" update. This greatly hinders Minecraft's growth. Additions need to fit into animated trailers too, which further inhibits new ideas.

If this keeps up they'll eventually lose to competitors like Hytale, which has no problems adding what players have always wanted. They don't care about being a PETA education game, a hyper realistic game, or a game hindered by arbitrary rules like "inhibiting creativity", they just want to make a fun fantasy survival game.

I think fireflies should be added as simple particle effects in swamps, players have taken a liking to the two-pixel bug ever since the reveal. Having said that, I'm still gonna thank the devs for all the hard work!
can you make the sculk shrieker count down reset when the warden digs down to make it better for people who evade him the first time
can you explain why so much was dropped I get 1.20 is likely to be big as 20 versions is a big thing if that’s why you Are reducing unneeded stuff just say that

- biomes can be revamp by adding more variant such as old growth variant. Eg: old growth jungle, jungle that has many layers of log, more dense without much update.

- revamp and adding more terrain feature will be a advantage in the wild update. Eg, arches, a feature that generate in exclusive area such as badlands, desert, windswept hills, and maybe mountains. It can also generate in the middle of a river, creating bridges. The second thing that can change is  ice spikes. It can be revamped by using shifted noise on them. While eroded badlands can generate more larger and higher.

- The frozen ocean is an exception, the iceberg can generate in any size and height, which it can even reach Y260. So, it is the only ocean biome that generate caves above sea, which only mainly ice.

- Then, the mossy boulders generate in old growth taigas biome can be further change by increases it's size. It also should contain one or two ore inside.

- The next feature that can be added is cliffs which generate in tall hills and mountains. It can help to expand the important uses of ladder. It  has flat face in some area, posing hazard to players

- valley can be added where biome can generate on the side of the cliff. Eg, grove generate bottom of mountain peaks as a plateaus, forest generate in the middle of a cliff as a plateau or bellow of a cliff.

- aquifer can generate in the middle mountains as craters which similar to springs in lush caves.

- mist, a type of air that appear in cold biomes that reduce visibility, should be added

- maybe new waterfall variant

- egg should can placed as a block similar to turtle egg, and should born as chick before turning into chicken.

- try improve water animation.
Maybe the Echo Geodes could very rarely spawn as ancient mining structures in Ancient Cities!

it could be more commonly found along the walls, and when the sculk sensor activates the sculk shrieker, the scream particles bounce off of the echo blocks and alert the warden, and they wouldn't drop anything when mined so you have to use echo shards to obtain them

I like that idea. Maybe they could be found on the walls around Ancient Cities as a defense from the Warden. (That clearly backfired because it would alert the Warden) Whoever lived in Ancient Cities seemed to have not liked sculk because wool is everywhere so that would make sense. And not getting anything from the block is a good-ish idea. But you should be able to still get some shards or have the block drop with Silk Touch.

Why? It doesn't need one. Netherite shouldn't be able to be compatible with fortune, and it's not even technically an ore. Ancient Debris are whatever is left of some ancient metal made artificially by something or someone... so you smelt it down into scrap metal.

1° why not?even diamonds are, and netherite is supposed to get for end-game, and till that you already would have fortune and silk touch, so i see no problem in that, and yes, ancient debris is tecnhcaly a ore, and i see it like a gold or iron ore, and since they're adding raw gold and iron, why not netherite?tbh, i would find more odd adding those raw iron and gold, and keeping ancient debris that way, rather than adding that to netherite too
it is a good idea because if all the minerals when you chop them with a pick without silk touch it gives you the raw mineral so why not do it also with the netherite

That would be too op, netherite is a late game material that is supposed to be very hard to get and it would ruin the fun, you obviously already have fortune and Mojang don't want you to use that to get a ton of late game stuff.
It isn't balanced, this would make it too easy to get netherite

Netherite doesnt need to be raw. Diamonds dont have a raw form. Emeralds dont have a raw for,. Coal doesnt have a raw form. this means that netherite doesnt need one. either. and fortune on netherite would be way to op.
Too overpowered.

Great idea. This would give both blast furnaces and lava as fuel a viable use. If it's possible, though, it should take three times as long to smelt as an ore in a regular furnace, or six times as long as in a blast furnace.
Great idea with a good balance and adding more direct use for specific items
Oh wait, you mean the raw ore blocks? Oops, I thought you meant the ores themselves. I take back what I said about it being overpowered...

The line and bobber do not show as cast. There is no indication that you cast other than the sound and the bubbles. It is possible to fish by sound, but sometimes I cast and reel-in with the same click and then I'm just sitting around wasting my time.
same! i came here just to post this. i tried logging out and back in but it didnt fix.
same fishing is invisible wich is kinda  annoying and mojang arent releasing a new snapshot soon by the lookes of it

this is a bug and not a suggestion, consider reporting as a bug  under the report bugs link instead of suggestions. 

 

Although this has already been fixed so actually dont
ok.

that is because mojang removed it.

btw i just wanna thank mojang,
that they removed the best ore in the GAME. It looks the best. and, the feeling you get when finding it first time in the world. it looks way better than stone and it feels safe having iron tools. also when having iron, or getting an update. you feel ready in your world. you can mine everything kill the zombies. and than. mojang removes iron. the most trusted ore, the oldest ore, the feel of getting an update. the confident feel when holding the iron tools. it al gone. and for what! ALUNINUM!?  the worse replace ment for such an legendary ore. so im begging you and probably many many other people return iron ore. and i think that a lot of people share this feeling with me. so return iron ore and restore the real feel of minecraft.

thanks
The iron looks ugly at 21 w08a! At 21 w07a was beautiful
That was a bug and it got fixed.
If we do this, then the Nether portals have to link out back at the top of the Nether, just below the roof.
We have more possibilities of layout and formating with tellraw for now...
But they are aquatic mobs. I like to think that the normal ghosts are fireproof because over time they grew a tolerance to the heat.
Yes

And if it is toggleable, then thank you for thinking of that.

edit: You should also make the bar changeable in the texture files.

I think the best way to incorporate this naturally and make it fun would be to give the function to the compass. For example, right-clicking it could turn the bar on or off, and removing the compass from your inventory would turn the feature off entirely. This would give it another practical use and a reason to carry one around.
I imagine they would do this as a small little hidden feature.
They already could, as seen in the Minecraft Live After-show.
